briefTitle: Ketamine for Acute Migraine in the Emergency Department
officialTitle: A Randomized Placebo-Controlled Trial of Sub-Dissociative Ketamine for Treatment of Acute Migraine-Type Headache in the Emergency Department

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 18-65 years of age
* Chief complaint of headache
* International Classification of Headache Disorder classification of migraine or probable migraine with or without aura
* Has decision making capacity
* Consent
* Provider determination of non-emergent cause

Exclusion Criteria:

* Over the age of 50 with first time headache
* Known adverse reaction or tolerance to study medication
* Headache due to trauma
* New onset, focal, abnormal, neurologic findings
* New onset seizures
* History of metastatic cancer or neoplasm
* Active psychotic symptoms
* Altered mental status
* Provider intends to preform lumbar puncture
* Pregnancy
* Breast feeding
* Previous enrollment in study
* Fever \> 100.3 F
* Physiologic instability (blood pressure \< 90/50 or \>170/100, heart rate \<50 or \>120, chronic respiratory, renal or hepatic failure)
* Suspected cardiac pain

primary.measure: Achievement of Pain Response After Ketamine Dose.
primary.description: NRS (National rating scale) pain score change from baseline following ketamine dose. Minimum score is 0, maximum score is 10, and higher scores mean worse pain.

secondary.measure: Categorical Pain Score Change From Baseline
secondary.description: change in baseline categorical pain score at 30 minutes (categorical pain intensity score from 0 to 3 where 0="no headache" and 3="severe headache")

other.measure: Functional Disability Score Change From Baseline
other.description: change in functional disability from baseline at 30 minutes (functional disability score from 0 to 3 where 0="no disruption of daily activities" and 3="performance of daily activities is severely impaired")
